DoNotWorry: Don't worry, next time you'll show them)
title: Play Poker Online Free
description: Free Texas Holdem Poker! Poker online right in your web browser, no download. Play against real people. PokerGloss is the most customizable poker you'll ever find.
keywords: poker, play poker, play poker online, play poker free, free poker, poker game, poker games

AboutUsPage.title: The PokerGloss team
AboutUsPage.description: Learn about the team at PokerGloss. You can read about the creators, the authors of the free online poker site.
AboutUsPage.OurMissionText: This has become a publicly sourced poker website with no mission but to show case it.

DennisGloss.Name: Dennis Gloss
DennisGloss.Text: Hi, I'm the owner and maintainer of this project which used to be called PokerBlow. Unfortunately, I ran out of money and had to close it. Years later I found strength to refactor it and present it to you as PokerGloss. Click on the GitHub link below to find more technical details.

AboutUsPage.ContactUsText: To report a problem, make a suggestion or to just say hello, you can email me at dennisgloss23@gmail.com or create an issue on github.com/glossd/pokergloss.

Survival.noTicketsMessage: You can obtain a ticket by winning a Freeroll

master.paradiseMessage: As part of your training I've created this simulator of the worlds. You're in heaven now. Raziel plays very passively. It shouldn't be too hard to win.
master.spiritWorldMessage: This is Spirit World. You have to analyze spirits you're playing with. It's not as hard as in Hell but be cautious.
master.hellMessage1: You've arrived to Hell. First you will have to face the elders. They've lost their skin and flesh after being in Hell for centuries. They play more aggressive than spirits.
master.hellMessage2: Now you'll be playing with demons. There will be up to three of them. The aggression and tightness will be more diverse.
master.hellMessage3: Congratulations! Now you've reached Archdemons. Be careful, don't let your emotions control you or you will face your defeat.

tutorial.title: How to play poker - Interactive Tutorial
tutorial.description: Learn how to play poker with easy-to-follow interactive poker tutorial.

pokerHands.wrongAnswer: This is wrong answer, think again

1.1: Welcome to your first lesson! Behind me you can see a poker table for six players. Your goal is to take chips from other players.
1.2: In Texas Hold'em everybody gets 2 cards. Afterwards there will be dealt 5 cards to the table. The player with the strongest combination of cards wins. Will get to it later.
1.3: Each player has a position on the table. Right now we're interested in Big Blind and Small Blind. Player with BB (Big Blind) is forced to put a minimal bet on the table and Small Blind must put half of BB chips.
1.4: It's your time to decide which action to make. If you FOLD you will be out of the game until the next deal. But remember when you fold you lose any chips you put on the table before. The CALL means someone did bet more than you. If you call you put the same number of chips to stay in the game. When you RAISE other players have to put the chips you raised on the table or fold. If everyone folds you win and take all the wagered chips. Let's make a CALL.
1.5: No one raised and the PreFlop round has ended. Three cards were dealt to the table, Flop round has started. The question for you is what kind of combination you have on the table. I'll give you a hint, look at the Jacks.
1.6: As of now you have a pair of the highest card of the table. No one can have Flush or Straight. It seems to be a good opportunity to bet. Let's bet half of the pot, 6 chips.
1.7: Three players folded. There are 30 chips in the pot. Each poker combination consists of 5 cards. Now there's going to be the sixth card on the table. Confusing? Well, you just have to find the best 5 cards with the highest combination. That will be your poker hand.
1.8: And the Turn round gave us Ace of clubs. It's not good. You're no longer have the highest pair. Unfortunately, you act first not knowing what kind of reaction your opponents have. 30 chips in the pot is good enough for now. Let's just Check.
1.9: Great! You've got Straight! 10, J, Q, K, A. Let's bet 15 chips, half of the pot.
1.10: Congratulations! You took 37 chips from other players. The last one had Two Pair of Q's and 10's which is weaker than Straight. Great job! You can get to the next lesson now or process all the information and return later.

2.1: Welcome to the 2nd lesson! You've got a very good pocket cards: Pair of Queens. You're big blind and act last on PreFlop. Let's see what other players will do.
2.2: Too many players called the raise of IVORY. You've got too strong cards to let all your opponents stay in the game. Let's re-raise 3 times the call, RAISE to 18 chips.
2.3: Great flop! You've got Set of Queens! Let's BET half a pot, 31 chips.
2.4: IVORY raised you and has gone all in. We're not scared to CALL. Let's see the cards!
2.5: It seems like your opponent has higher ranking hand: Straight. Don't worry, you made all the right moves. Let's just see the Turn and River. Luck is an undisputed part of poker.
2.6: Luck is definitely on your side! You've won with Full House! Let's go to the next tutorial.

3.1: Welcome to the 3d lesson! You busted out IVORY in previous lesson. Now it's only 5 players at the table.
3.2: With your cards you could have Flush or Straight. Only two gaps. Queen as the high card. Your chances are pretty good. Let's CALL.
3.3: In spite of having Pair of Queens it is the lowest. Someone could easily have a pair of Aces or Kings. Unfortunately you act first. Let's check and see how other players will react.
3.4: So Diamond bet a whole pot. He's probably having an Ace. The right move is to FOLD.
3.5: That was a classic poker bluff. Diamond was in the dealer position. The player in that position acts last on PostFlop (Flop, Turn and River rounds). Everyone checked hence he thought no one had anything good. He made a bet, everyone folded and he won the pot.

4.1: Welcome to the 4th lesson! You've got suited connectors without gaps. They are the most likely to make Straight or Flush. Let's call.
4.2: Now you're in the dealer position. It means you will act last on PostFlop. Considering this round will end now you should CALL.
4.3: The situation is not too bad. You already have a pair and Flush draw. Flush or Straight draw means you miss only one card. Let's CALL
4.4: Great! You've got Set of Tens and Flush draw on Turn. But thinking about Diamond's move he's probably having the ten of clubs. Your supporting card 9 of hearts is not too high so you shouldn't show any aggression, just CALL.
4.5: You can lose only if someone has 10 and King or two Kings in their hands which is unlikely. After all you only have to call 28 chips to stay in the game so the choice is obvious - CALL
4.6: You and Diamond have the same combination of five best cards therefore you shared the pot.

5.1: Welcome to the 5th tutorial! You should consider blinds as a payment for staying in the game. 7 and 2 off-suited are the worst pocket cards. Then goes 82o, 83o. The price to see the flop would cost 5 big blinds and probably nothing good will come. If you called it'd be considered limping. So FOLD.
5.2: A player don't have to show his cards if everyone folded. Diamond mucked. We may never know whether he was bluffing or not. You can disable your auto-muck configuration in the settings.
5.3: You've got suited connectors with one gap and only half of BB to CALL. You should do it.
5.4: Splendid! It's an open-ended Straight Flush draw. Any spade cards (9 in total) from the deck would make a flush. Any 9 or 4 (8 cards) would make a straight. Overall there are 15 cards in the deck. There's 54% one of them will be dealt. Let's BET half of the pot, 4 chips.
5.5: At least one of them should have a pair of Aces. KENNY seems to be quite aggressive. For now let's CALL.
5.6: Calm down. You've got a Straight Flush. No one at the table can beat that but someone will probably make a bet. Let's play it slow. Just pretend you have a weak hand. Let's CHECK.
5.7: You could re-raise but you'd give out that you have a strong hand. There's the River round, you don't want to scare anyone especially Diamond. Let them raise on the River by CALLing now.
5.8: The strategy is the same - Slow play. Just CHECK, let them raise. When it will be your turn you will re-raise. That move called check-raise.
5.9: Great! Our rival has fallen into our trap. If you acted aggressively he wouldn't probably wagered that much. Now you will take him by surprise. Go ALL IN.
5.10: Great Job! Now you know the basics of poker. You can train your poker skills in single player survival mode.

Landing.advantage3: Poker Single Player in Survival mode
Landing.advantage4: Create your own public or private tables and tournaments with customizable options
